alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 24 at 2:23PM PST until November 25 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Long Period Swell Moving in Thursday... Thursday morning the forerunners of a long-period swell are expected to move into the area. Initially these waves are expected to be around 6 feet at 18 seconds and quickly build to over 10 feet at 16 to 18 seconds by late evening. ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large unexpected waves along the coast. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Southwestern Humboldt and Mendocino Coast Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Friday.. . * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
